title: A Star In Orion Is Dimming. Is It About To Explode?
description: Okay, it wouldn't technically be an explosion. And if it's "about" to happen, it already happened. About 650 years ago. We'll explain, with astronomer Emily Levesque, who studies massive stars at the University of Washington. Follow Short Wave's Emily Kwong on Twitter @emilykwong1234. Email the show at shortwave@npr.org.
copyright: Copyright 2019-2021 NPR - For Personal Use Only
itunes:title: A Star In Orion Is Dimming. Is It About To Explode?
itunes:author: NPR
itunes:summary: Scientists might pop champagne if they see signs of a supernova in the sky.
itunes:subtitle: Scientists might pop champagne if they see signs of a supernova in the sky.
